description.value: Fifteen-point scale for expressing a personâ€™s level of consciousness, from fully awake to deep unconsciousness, in a number: the so-called EMV score. The Glasgow Coma Scale score or EMV (Eye-Motor-Verbal) score is a scale to measure the extent of consciousness, based on eye, verbal and motor responses to specific prescribed sound and pain stimuli.

purpose.value: A derived profile from [zib-GlasgowComaScale](http://nictiz.nl/fhir/StructureDefinition/zib-GlasgowComaScale) to provide a version better suited for implementation purposes. This profile augments the base profile with elements found in the various use cases that have adopted the zib.
